de.sciss.net
Class SpecificOSCMessage

java.lang.Object
  de.sciss.net.OSCPacket
      de.sciss.net.OSCMessage
          de.sciss.net.SpecificOSCMessage
Deprecated. one of the next netutil versions will use an alternative osc message encoder / decoder class 

public abstract class SpecificOSCMessage
extends OSCMessage

Specialized OSC message class for optimized encoding and decoding.

In some cases, using the ordinary OSCMessage class may be inconvenient or inefficient. An example is "/b_setn" to transmit buffer content to supercollider. Using OSCMessage, this would require to create an array of Float objects which implies a huge processing and RAM overhead. So, one could create a subclass of the abstract SpecificOSCMessage class that stores the content in a float[] and can use a FloatBuffer object to speed up encoding and decoding.

An example of this is the OSCBufSetNMessage found in the file MaxBridge.java which is part of the Meloncillo source code (sourceforge.net/projects/meloncillo).

Version:
0.11, 21-Jun-05
Author:
Hanns Holger Rutz

Field Detail

FLOATTAGS

protected static final byte[] FLOATTAGS
Deprecated. 
Convenient array of 'f' chars to use for fast creation of "/b_setn" messages, for example. The array has size 256.

Constructor Detail

SpecificOSCMessage

protected SpecificOSCMessage(String name,
                             Object[] args)
Deprecated. 
Creates a new instance of SpecificOSCMessage. The name is obligatory, while args may be set to OSCMessage.NO_ARGS initially, and then filled in later.

Parameters:
name - the OSC command, like "/s_new"
args - array of arguments.
Method Detail

decodeSpecific

protected abstract OSCMessage decodeSpecific(ByteBuffer b)
                                      throws BufferUnderflowException,
                                             IOException
Deprecated. 
This gets called by OSCPacket when it finds a message matching this SpecificOSCMessage's name string in the decoding process.

Parameters:
b - ByteBuffer pointing right at the beginning of the type declaration section of the OSC message, i.e. the name was skipped before.
Throws:
IOException - in case some of the reading or decoding procedures failed.
BufferUnderflowException - in case of a parsing error that causes the method to read past the buffer limit
See Also:
OSCPacket.decode( ByteBuffer, Map )
